meanings.definition: A seal attached to a papal bull.
meanings.sent1: The bulla on the document showed it was official.
meanings.sent2: The pope's bulla was carefully preserved in the archives.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to have a bulla to stamp his drawings.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright bulla on a dark parchment.
meanings.sent5: The shiny bulla gleamed under the light, signifying authority.

meanings.sent1: The aroma of freshly baked bulla filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She spread butter on the warm bulla before serving it.
meanings.sent3: The bulla was so delicious that they finished it in minutes.
meanings.sent4: The golden crust of the bulla reminded him of a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The bulla was soft and fluffy, a perfect accompaniment to the soup.

meanings.definition: A blister or vesicle on the skin.
meanings.sent1: After the burn, a painful bulla formed on his hand.
meanings.sent2: She applied ointment to the bulla to help it heal faster.
meanings.sent3: The bulla on his foot made walking uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The bulla looked like a tiny bubble ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The doctor advised not to pop the bulla to prevent infection.
